Text: (I'm being watched.)

(I feel multiple sets of eyes on me. Everyone is
staring and whispering.)
Look, it's him.

I heard he dropped a log in his drawers at full
sprint...
Eww...
H-Hey, man. Wh-What a mess yesterday, huh?
G-Good morning. That was a close one.

Hey, morning. I get the feeling today's gonna be even
more of a trial.
Skel and Po's smiles become strained.
(I let out a big sigh.)
More importantly...

Did you bring that poo... I mean, poo-recious
chocolate from yesterday?!
Uh, yeah.

Alright, then come lunchtime we launch Operation
Present.
Heheheh, I can't wait.

(And so it's lunchtime. Skel drags us along, saying
he's going to show us how it's done.)
(It's the classroom of a second-year student.)
Ah...H-H-H-Hello!
W-W-Would you l-l-l-like s-s-some ch-chocolate?
S-Skel is going for an upperclassman...!
(He could not have picked a more side-character move.)
Hey!
Uh...
You want something with my betrothed?

(Skel instantly goes rigid. Behind him stands a
massive upperclassman.)
Ack?! Uh, no, um...
Hey, bud. Let's go have a chat.
I'll hold onto the chocolates...
Uh, oh... Help...!
(We turn away, ignoring Skel's cries.)
Let's go.
(We can hear Skel's pleas for help from behind us.)
(Po heads for the library.)

(The academy's library is quite large due to being
shared by the Academy for Dark Knights and
the Academy of Science.)

(Of course, the muscleheads of the school don't
really use this place. Myself included.)

So you have a crush on a girl in the science
academy, eh?
Yeah. I won't copy Skel!

I've researched every last detail, from her favorite
food, to when she leaves school, how many steps
it takes her to get home, her dorm room number,
which toilet she uses most, her skirt length,

the color of her underwear, and even her
measurements!!!
Prepare for the victory of Po Tato!!!
The triumphant Po bursts into a dash.
My! Fair! Lady!!!
Eeeeeeek! It's my stalker!!!
(I hear a scream in the distance almost instantly.)
Uh, oh, I... Cid?!
A stalker?!
This potato face!?
Ciiiiiiid!!!

(Welp... I'll just hand this stuff off to the first
person I see and end this event.)
(I stand up with the chocolates in one hand.)

(When was the last time I even visited the library?
I feel like I am only really seeing it for the first
time.)

This code... It's so similar to what my mother was
studying...
(I decide to speak to the academy girl next to me.)
Yes.
Yes...?
Here's some chocolate.
Huh...?

(She's a pretty, pink-haired girl. I leave the box of
chocolates and begin to show myself out.)
Huh?
U-Um, who are you...?
(I hear the confused question from behind me.)

(The girl's face looks familiar, but I don't remember
from where.)
Hmm...

Upon inspection, she has just received something that
smells sweet but is unknown to her. The boy who gave
them to her called them "chocolates," however...
What are these?
Is something the matter, Sherry?
F-Father...!
Oh, I see you have some chocolate.
Chocolate...?
A high-class candy that is quite popular lately.
I got it from a boy just now.
I see... I'm certain it was meant as a gift for you.
...Huh?

"Love at first sight," as they say. Those are very
special chocolates that people line up from the
wee hours of the morning to buy. He must have
worked quite hard to procure them for you.
Love...at first sight...
Sherry blushes slightly.
How will you respond?
He's surely awaiting an answer.
B-But I...
Sherry turns bright red and looks bewildered.

Your studies are important, but you should also learn
how people interact. That is what the academy is for.
...I understand.
So how is the deciphering going?
I've only just begun...
Still blushing, Sherry smiles.
Yes, I can imagine so.

However, I do know one thing. This artifact uses a
distinctive code.
A distinctive code?

Yes, one that was likely used by an ancient nation or
organization. And...it's similar to the code that
Mother was studying.
I see... Lukreia was a superb researcher, yes...
Lutheran closes his eyes as if remembering the past.

I want to know the meaning of the cipher Mother was
studying before she died.
This is a good job, then.
Yes.
*cough, cough* E-Excuse me... *cough*
Father! Are you alright?

Sherry hurriedly rubs Lutheran's back. He is a
frail man with sunken cheeks.
I-I'm fine. No need to worry.
Lutheran calms his ragged breathing.

Just when I had been feeling so well...
This sickness...
Father...

Please don't worry. More importantly, there's been
further talk of opportunities for you to study abroad.
Laugus...

They recognize your world-class intelligence. A trip
to Laugus will certainly benefit you. This is a great
opportunity.
But I can't leave you when you're so ill, Father.
Lutheran pats Sherry's head.
Sherry, please don't concern yourself with me.

But... If you hadn't adopted me after Mother's
death...I surely would have died.
I...I want to save you, just as you saved me.
Sherry's eyes glisten as she speaks.
Sherry... What a good daughter you are.
Lutheran smiles kindly.
Continue your studies. And eat those chocolates.
Okay...
Father...

The artifact glimmers next to these two deeply-
connected souls.
